posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.56 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Saint Patrick’s Day was so last month, so we added a workaround for an iOS bug that occasionally causes a green square to appear after pasting an image.
  • We squashed another bug that prevented you from saving multiple images to your camera roll in messages that included an album.
  • And we also fixed a crash that could happen after trying to share a call link on your iPad, so you don’t need to pick up your phone in order to make a new call.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.55 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.56.0.738-beta

35 new commits since 7.55.0.732-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.56 [1]

  • Switch to Xcode 16.3 [2]

  • Split logic for updating chat list reminder views [3]

  • Retry joins via invite links when conflicts occur [4]

  • Use the most recent preview when joining via link [5]

  • Re-warm caches each time the NSE is triggered [6]

  • Convert TSRequest to a struct [7]

  • Add Registration UI for confirming backup restore [8]

  • Pass in the ProvisioningSocketManager to avoid racing [9]

  • Fix crash when tapping “Share call link” on iPad [10]

  • Remove unused uninstallSticker parameter [11]

  • Restore the ability to use local master key during reglock [12]

  • Allow profile reuploads to modify the profile [13]

  • Fix inverted “is new registration” check [14]

  • Always disable PNI Hello World in registration [15]

  • Update conversation header spacing [16]

  • List group members in conversation header [17]

  • Remove unused method [18]

  • Remove redundant cache check in sticker download [19]

  • Remove a few calls to legacyAddress [20]

  • Remove TSContactThread’s use of legacyAddress [21]

  • Asyncify didPickLocation & related methods [22]

  • Clean up DebouncedEvents [23]

  • Don’t show “60m” for messages that are an hour old [24]

  • Fix race conditions in LinkPreviewFetchStateTest [25]

  • Fix link preview showing failed icon when downloading image [26]

  • Do not treat 1x1 images as stickers [27]

  • Clean up OrderedSet [28]

  • Improve backup key entry behavior [29]

  • Improve performance enumerating message batches [30]

  • Indicate whether or not a thread is pre-selected [31]

  • TSAttachment migration logging/error handling improvements [32]

  • Fix issue saving multiple images at once [33]

  • Update release notes [34]

  • Update translations [35]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.55.0.732-beta…7.56.0.738-beta

Localization changes

Update went successfully. The text I reported as not translated is indeed translated again, thank you.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Thank you for fixing the registration lock issues that were cropping up :)
There’sa bug. Sharing a screenshot in dark mode, the app share screen is in light mode. iOS.

Okay.

iPhone dark mode.
iOS 18 latest.
Safari/any other app eg NY Times.
Take a screenshot of article.
Press share button to share into signal.
The share page is light mode. The sharing progress page/pop up is also light mode.
It was fixed at one point but has returned.
(Sometimes the phone is in light mode and the share screen and page is in dark mode).
Definitely there.
(Signal protected by Face ID lock)
Tried to reproduce this, was not able to.

A for everyone deleted message has the typical „tombstone“ look in the info screen

IMG_68311179×775 74.2 KB

While it hasn’t in the regular chat view
IMG_68321179×321 63 KB

Also:
Signal crashes when trying to edit a message with a @user1 when user1 left the group after the message had been sent but before the editing.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.57 release

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.57 release.
